car_1.question: How many car models are produced by each maker? List the count and the maker full name.
car_1.query: SELECT COUNT ( * ) , t2.fullname FROM model_list AS t1 JOIN car_makers AS t2 ON t1.maker = t2.id GROUP BY t2.id
car_1.schema: CREATE TABLE car_makers (Id NUMBER, Maker TEXT, FullName TEXT); CREATE TABLE model_list (ModelId NUMBER, Maker NUMBER, Model TEXT); CREATE TABLE car_names (MakeId NUMBER, Model TEXT, Make TEXT);

car_1.question: Which models are the most popular?
car_1.query: SELECT t1.model FROM model_list AS t1 JOIN car_makers AS t2 ON t1.maker = t2.id GROUP BY t2.id ORDER BY COUNT ( * ) DESC LIMIT 1
car_1.schema: CREATE TABLE car_makers (Id NUMBER, Maker TEXT, FullName TEXT); CREATE TABLE model_list (ModelId NUMBER, Maker NUMBER, Model TEXT); CREATE TABLE car_names (MakeId NUMBER, Model TEXT, Make TEXT);

car_1.question: Which companies have three or more models?
car_1.query: SELECT COUNT ( * ) , t2.fullname , t2.id FROM model_list AS t1 JOIN car_makers AS t2 ON t1.maker = t2.id GROUP BY t2.id HAVING COUNT ( * ) > = 3
car_1.schema: CREATE TABLE car_makers (Id NUMBER, Maker TEXT, FullName TEXT); CREATE TABLE model_list (ModelId NUMBER, Maker NUMBER, Model TEXT); CREATE TABLE car_names (MakeId NUMBER, Model TEXT, Make TEXT);

car_1.question: what is the highest horsepower on the table?

car_1.query: SELECT t1.contid , t1.continent , COUNT ( * ) FROM continents AS t1 JOIN countries AS t2 ON t1.contid = t2.continent GROUP BY t1.contid
car_1.schema: CREATE TABLE continents (ContId NUMBER, Continent TEXT); CREATE TABLE countries (CountryId NUMBER, CountryName TEXT, Continent NUMBER);

car_1.question: which models are lighter than 3500?
car_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT t1.model FROM model_list AS t1 JOIN car_names AS t2 ON t1.model = t2.model JOIN cars_data AS t3 ON t2.makeid = t3.id JOIN car_makers AS t4 ON t1.maker = t4.id WHERE t3.weight < 3500
car_1.schema: CREATE TABLE model_list (ModelId NUMBER, Model TEXT); CREATE TABLE car_names (Model TEXT); CREATE TABLE cars_data (Weight NUMBER);

car_1.question: what is the weight of  BMW?
car_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT t3.weight FROM model_list AS t1 JOIN car_names AS t2 ON t1.model = t2.model JOIN cars_data AS t3 ON t2.makeid = t3.id JOIN car_makers AS t4 ON t1.maker = t4.id WHERE t1.model = "bmw"

car_1.schema: CREATE TABLE countries (CountryId NUMBER); CREATE TABLE car_makers (Id NUMBER, Maker TEXT, FullName TEXT, Country TEXT); CREATE TABLE model_list (ModelId NUMBER, Maker NUMBER, Model TEXT); CREATE TABLE car_names (MakeId NUMBER, Model TEXT, Make TEXT);

car_1.question: What are the full name of amc? | Did you mean the full name of the car maker amc? | Yes
car_1.query: SELECT fullname FROM car_makers WHERE maker = "amc"
car_1.schema: CREATE TABLE car_makers (Id NUMBER, Maker TEXT, FullName TEXT); CREATE TABLE model_list (Maker NUMBER, Model TEXT); CREATE TABLE car_names (MakeId NUMBER, Model TEXT, Make TEXT);

car_1.question: What kind of car is produced in Germany? | Did you mean the car models produced in Germany? | Yes
car_1.query: SELECT t3.model FROM countries AS t1 JOIN car_makers AS t2 ON t1.countryid = t2.country JOIN model_list AS t3 ON t2.id = t3.maker WHERE t1.countryname = "germany"
car_1.schema: CREATE TABLE continents (ContId NUMBER, Continent TEXT); CREATE TABLE countries (CountryId NUMBER, CountryName TEXT, Continent NUMBER); CREATE TABLE car_makers (Id NUMBER, Maker TEXT, FullName TEXT, Country TEXT); CREATE TABLE model_list (Maker NUMBER, Model TEXT); CREATE TABLE car_names (MakeId NUMBER, Model TEXT, Make TEXT);

car_1.question: What are the model id of BMW?
car_1.query: SELECT modelid FROM model_list WHERE model = "bmw"

car_1.question: What are the id and names of the countries which have more than 3 cars makers or produce the 'flat' model?
car_1.query: SELECT t1.countryid , t1.countryname FROM countries AS t1 JOIN car_makers AS t2 ON t1.countryid = t2.country GROUP BY t1.countryid HAVING COUNT ( * ) > 3 UNION SELECT t1.countryid , t1.countryname FROM countries AS t1 JOIN car_makers AS t2 ON t1.countryid = t2.country JOIN model_list AS t3 ON t2.id = t3.maker WHERE t3.model = 'fiat'
car_1.schema: CREATE TABLE continents (ContId NUMBER, Continent TEXT); CREATE TABLE countries (CountryId NUMBER, CountryName TEXT, Continent NUMBER); CREATE TABLE car_makers (Id NUMBER, Maker TEXT, FullName TEXT, Country TEXT); CREATE TABLE model_list (ModelId NUMBER, Maker NUMBER, Model TEXT); CREATE TABLE car_names (MakeId NUMBER, Model TEXT, Make TEXT);

car_1.question: What are the cars with the lowest horsepower? | Do you mean the id of the car with the lowest horsepower? | Yes please.
car_1.query: SELECT id FROM cars_data ORDER BY horsepower LIMIT 1
car_1.schema: CREATE TABLE car_names (MakeId NUMBER); CREATE TABLE cars_data (Id NUMBER, Horsepower TEXT);

car_1.question: What is the average horsepower of all the cars?
car_1.query: SELECT AVG ( horsepower ) FROM cars_data
car_1.schema: CREATE TABLE car_names (MakeId NUMBER); CREATE TABLE cars_data (Id NUMBER, MPG TEXT, Horsepower TEXT);

car_1.question: Can you list the car ids of all the cars with lower than the average horsepower?
car_1.query: SELECT t1.id FROM cars_data AS t1 JOIN car_names AS t2 ON t1.id = t2.makeid WHERE t1.horsepower < ( SELECT AVG ( horsepower ) FROM cars_data )
car_1.schema: CREATE TABLE car_names (MakeId NUMBER); CREATE TABLE cars_data (Id NUMBER, MPG TEXT, Horsepower TEXT);

car_1.question: Could you add the model and make of each of those into the table please?
car_1.query: SELECT t1.id ,t2.model FROM cars_data AS t1 JOIN car_names AS t2 ON t1.id = t2.makeid WHERE t1.horsepower < ( SELECT AVG ( horsepower ) FROM cars_data )
car_1.schema: CREATE TABLE model_list (ModelId NUMBER, Model TEXT); CREATE TABLE car_names (MakeId NUMBER, Model TEXT, Make TEXT); CREATE TABLE cars_data (Id NUMBER, MPG TEXT, Horsepower TEXT);

car_1.question: Which models are manufactured by the maker with the name "General Motors"?
car_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT t2.model FROM car_names AS t1 JOIN model_list AS t2 ON t1.model = t2.model JOIN car_makers AS t3 ON t2.maker = t3.id JOIN cars_data AS t4 ON t1.makeid = t4.id WHERE t3.fullname = 'General Motors'
car_1.schema: CREATE TABLE car_makers (Id NUMBER, Maker TEXT, FullName TEXT); CREATE TABLE model_list (ModelId NUMBER, Maker NUMBER, Model TEXT); CREATE TABLE car_names (MakeId NUMBER, Model TEXT, Make TEXT);

car_1.question: How about models that weight more than 3500?
car_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT t2.model FROM car_names AS t1 JOIN model_list AS t2 ON t1.model = t2.model JOIN car_makers AS t3 ON t2.maker = t3.id JOIN cars_data AS t4 ON t1.makeid = t4.id WHERE t4.weight > 3500
car_1.schema: CREATE TABLE car_makers (Id NUMBER, Maker TEXT, FullName TEXT); CREATE TABLE model_list (ModelId NUMBER, Maker NUMBER, Model TEXT); CREATE TABLE car_names (MakeId NUMBER, Model TEXT, Make TEXT); CREATE TABLE cars_data (Id NUMBER, Weight NUMBER);

car_1.question: What is the make and model of the car with the largest horsepower?
car_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT t2.model, t3.maker FROM car_names AS t1 JOIN model_list AS t2 ON t1.model = t2.model JOIN car_makers AS t3 ON t2.maker = t3.id JOIN cars_data AS t4 ON t1.makeid = t4.id WHERE t3.fullname = 'General Motors' ORDER BY t4.horsepower DESC LIMIT 1
car_1.schema: CREATE TABLE car_makers (Id NUMBER, Maker TEXT, FullName TEXT); CREATE TABLE model_list (ModelId NUMBER, Maker NUMBER, Model TEXT); CREATE TABLE car_names (MakeId NUMBER, Model TEXT, Make TEXT); CREATE TABLE cars_data (Id NUMBER, Horsepower TEXT, Weight NUMBER);

car_1.question: How many cars manufactured by General Motors get more than 15 mpg?
car_1.query: SELECT COUNT ( * ) FROM car_names AS t1 JOIN model_list AS t2 ON t1.model = t2.model JOIN car_makers AS t3 ON t2.maker = t3.id JOIN cars_data AS t4 ON t1.makeid = t4.id WHERE t3.fullname = 'General Motors' AND t4.mpg > 15
car_1.schema: CREATE TABLE car_makers (Id NUMBER, Maker TEXT, FullName TEXT); CREATE TABLE model_list (ModelId NUMBER, Maker NUMBER, Model TEXT); CREATE TABLE car_names (MakeId NUMBER, Model TEXT, Make TEXT); CREATE TABLE cars_data (Id NUMBER, MPG TEXT, Horsepower TEXT, Weight NUMBER);

car_1.question: What is the make and model of the car manufactured by General Motors that gets the highest mpg?
car_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT t1.make, t1.model FROM car_names AS t1 JOIN model_list AS t2 ON t1.model = t2.model JOIN car_makers AS t3 ON t2.maker = t3.id JOIN cars_data AS t4 ON t1.makeid = t4.id WHERE t3.fullname = 'General Motors' ORDER BY t4.mpg DESC LIMIT 1
car_1.schema: CREATE TABLE car_makers (Id NUMBER, Maker TEXT, FullName TEXT); CREATE TABLE model_list (ModelId NUMBER, Maker NUMBER, Model TEXT); CREATE TABLE car_names (MakeId NUMBER, Model TEXT, Make TEXT); CREATE TABLE cars_data (Id NUMBER, MPG TEXT, Horsepower TEXT, Weight NUMBER);

concert_singer.question: Find the name and location of the stadiums which some concerts happened in the years of both 2014 and 2015.
concert_singer.query: SELECT t2.name , t2.location FROM concert AS t1 JOIN stadium AS t2 ON t1.stadium_id = t2.stadium_id WHERE t1.year = 2014 INTERSECT SELECT t2.name , t2.location FROM concert AS t1 JOIN stadium AS t2 ON t1.stadium_id = t2.stadium_id WHERE t1.year = 2015
concert_singer.schema: CREATE TABLE stadium (Stadium_ID NUMBER, Location TEXT, Name TEXT); CREATE TABLE concert (concert_Name TEXT, Stadium_ID TEXT, Year TEXT);

student_transcripts_tracking.question: Find the first name of the students who permanently live in the country Haiti.

student_transcripts_tracking.question: Which cause has the least enrollment? | Do you want the course id or course name? | the course name
student_transcripts_tracking.query: SELECT t1.course_name FROM courses AS t1 JOIN student_enrolment_courses AS t2 ON t1.course_id = t2.course_id GROUP BY t1.course_name ORDER BY COUNT ( * ) LIMIT 1
student_transcripts_tracking.schema: CREATE TABLE Courses (course_id NUMBER, course_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Sections (course_id NUMBER); CREATE TABLE Student_Enrolment_Courses (student_course_id NUMBER, course_id NUMBER);

student_transcripts_tracking.question: What is the course ID of Math?
student_transcripts_tracking.query: SELECT course_id FROM courses WHERE course_name = "math"
student_transcripts_tracking.schema: CREATE TABLE Courses (course_id NUMBER, course_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Sections (course_id NUMBER); CREATE TABLE Student_Enrolment_Courses (student_course_id NUMBER, course_id NUMBER);

student_transcripts_tracking.question: How many students enrolled a course with the id of 14
student_transcripts_tracking.query: SELECT COUNT ( * ) FROM courses AS t1 JOIN student_enrolment_courses AS t2 ON t1.course_id = t2.course_id GROUP BY t1.course_name HAVING t1.course_id = 14
student_transcripts_tracking.schema: CREATE TABLE Courses (course_id NUMBER, course_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Sections (course_id NUMBER); CREATE TABLE Student_Enrolment (student_enrolment_id NUMBER, student_id NUMBER); CREATE TABLE Student_Enrolment_Courses (student_course_id NUMBER, course_id NUMBER, student_enrolment_id NUMBER);

dog_kennels.question: Hmm, can you put the owner ids, dog ids and the cost of treatment in a table?
dog_kennels.query: SELECT t1.owner_id , t2.dog_id ,t3.cost_of_treatment FROM owners AS t1 JOIN dogs AS t2 ON t1.owner_id = t2.owner_id JOIN treatments AS t3 ON t2.dog_id = t3.dog_id

dog_kennels.question: Which owner name and id has paid the largest amount of money in total for their dogs? | Did  you mean  the  full name? | Just the first name will be fine.
dog_kennels.query: SELECT t1.first_name,t1.owner_id FROM owners AS t1 JOIN dogs AS t2 ON t1.owner_id = t2.owner_id JOIN treatments AS t3 ON t2.dog_id = t3.dog_id GROUP BY t1.owner_id ORDER BY SUM ( t3.cost_of_treatment ) DESC LIMIT 1
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Owners (owner_id NUMBER, first_name TEXT, last_name TEXT, zip_code TEXT); CREATE TABLE Dogs (dog_id NUMBER, owner_id NUMBER, name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Professionals (zip_code TEXT); CREATE TABLE Treatments (dog_id NUMBER, cost_of_treatment NUMBER);

dog_kennels.question: As a last thing, can you also tell me the owner id and zip code of Jaclyn Stoltenberg, who has paid the largest amount of money in total for their dogs?

dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Owners (first_name TEXT, last_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Professionals (professional_id NUMBER, role_code TEXT, first_name TEXT, street TEXT, city TEXT, state TEXT, last_name TEXT);

dog_kennels.question: List the names of all professionals with the state Indiana.
dog_kennels.query: SELECT first_name FROM professionals WHERE state = "Indiana"

dog_kennels.question: which professionals live in state of indiana? | What information do you want to know about these professionals? | I would like to know all the information about professionals?
dog_kennels.query: SELECT * FROM professionals WHERE state = 'Indiana'
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Owners (state TEXT); CREATE TABLE Professionals (professional_id NUMBER, city TEXT, state TEXT, last_name TEXT);

dog_kennels.question: ok, I need to know the cell number of taryn
dog_kennels.query: SELECT cell_number FROM professionals WHERE first_name = "Taryn"
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Owners (first_name TEXT, last_name TEXT, state TEXT, cell_number TEXT); CREATE TABLE Professionals (professional_id NUMBER, first_name TEXT, city TEXT, state TEXT, last_name TEXT, home_phone TEXT, cell_number TEXT);

dog_kennels.question: What are the ids of the professionals?
dog_kennels.query: SELECT professional_id FROM professionals
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Owners (owner_id NUMBER); CREATE TABLE Professionals (professional_id NUMBER, role_code TEXT, last_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Treatments (professional_id NUMBER);

dog_kennels.question: What is the role of each of the professionals?
dog_kennels.query: SELECT professional_id, role_code FROM professionals
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Owners (owner_id NUMBER); CREATE TABLE Professionals (professional_id NUMBER, role_code TEXT, last_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Treatments (professional_id NUMBER);

dog_kennels.question: Could I please have their email address and which of them did not perform any operate any treatment on dogs.
dog_kennels.query: SELECT professional_id , role_code , email_address FROM professionals EXCEPT SELECT t1.professional_id , t1.role_code , t1.email_address FROM professionals AS t1 JOIN treatments AS t2 ON t1.professional_id = t2.professional_id
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Owners (owner_id NUMBER, email_address TEXT); CREATE TABLE Dogs (dog_id NUMBER); CREATE TABLE Professionals (professional_id NUMBER, role_code TEXT, last_name TEXT, email_address TEXT); CREATE TABLE Treatments (dog_id NUMBER, professional_id NUMBER);

dog_kennels.question: Which first names are used for professionals or owners?
dog_kennels.query: SELECT first_name FROM professionals UNION SELECT first_name FROM owners
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Owners (owner_id NUMBER, first_name TEXT, last_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Professionals (professional_id NUMBER, role_code TEXT, first_name TEXT, last_name TEXT);

dog_kennels.question: Which first names are used for professionals or owners, but are not used as dog names?
dog_kennels.query: SELECT first_name FROM professionals UNION SELECT first_name FROM owners EXCEPT SELECT name FROM dogs
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Owners (owner_id NUMBER, first_name TEXT, last_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Dogs (owner_id NUMBER, name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Professionals (professional_id NUMBER, role_code TEXT, first_name TEXT, last_name TEXT);

dog_kennels.question: Which first names are used for professionals or owners, and are used as dog names?
dog_kennels.query: SELECT first_name FROM professionals UNION SELECT first_name FROM owners UNION SELECT name FROM dogs
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Owners (owner_id NUMBER, first_name TEXT, last_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Dogs (owner_id NUMBER, name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Professionals (professional_id NUMBER, role_code TEXT, first_name TEXT, last_name TEXT);

dog_kennels.question: What is the phone number of the professional who has done the most treatment.
dog_kennels.query: SELECT t1.cell_number FROM professionals AS t1 JOIN treatments AS t2 ON t1.professional_id = t2.professional_id GROUP BY t1.professional_id ORDER BY COUNT ( * ) DESC LIMIT 1
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Owners (home_phone TEXT, cell_number TEXT); CREATE TABLE Professionals (professional_id NUMBER, last_name TEXT, home_phone TEXT, cell_number TEXT); CREATE TABLE Treatments (professional_id NUMBER);

dog_kennels.question: What are the professional id of the professionals who have done at least two types of treatments?
dog_kennels.query: SELECT t1.professional_id FROM professionals AS t1 JOIN treatments AS t2 ON t1.professional_id = t2.professional_id GROUP BY t1.professional_id HAVING COUNT ( * ) > = 2
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Owners (home_phone TEXT, cell_number TEXT); CREATE TABLE Professionals (professional_id NUMBER, last_name TEXT, home_phone TEXT, cell_number TEXT); CREATE TABLE Treatments (professional_id NUMBER, treatment_type_code TEXT);

dog_kennels.question: How many professionals have done only one treatment?
dog_kennels.query: SELECT COUNT ( * ) FROM ( SELECT * FROM professionals AS t1 JOIN treatments AS t2 ON t1.professional_id = t2.professional_id GROUP BY t1.professional_id HAVING COUNT ( * ) = 1 )
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Owners (home_phone TEXT, cell_number TEXT); CREATE TABLE Professionals (professional_id NUMBER, last_name TEXT, home_phone TEXT, cell_number TEXT); CREATE TABLE Treatments (professional_id NUMBER, treatment_type_code TEXT);

dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Owners (state TEXT, email_address TEXT); CREATE TABLE Professionals (role_code TEXT, first_name TEXT, city TEXT, state TEXT, last_name TEXT, email_address TEXT);

dog_kennels.question: Hello!  Can you tell me how many dogs have not gone through any treatment?
dog_kennels.query: SELECT COUNT ( * ) FROM dogs WHERE dog_id NOT IN ( SELECT dog_id FROM treatments )
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Breeds (breed_code TEXT); CREATE TABLE Dogs (dog_id NUMBER, owner_id NUMBER, breed_code TEXT, name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Treatments (dog_id NUMBER);

dog_kennels.question: Thank you for that!  Can you tell me how many of these dogs were abandoned?
dog_kennels.query: SELECT COUNT ( * ) FROM dogs WHERE abandoned_yn = 1 AND dog_id NOT IN ( SELECT dog_id FROM treatments )
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Breeds (breed_code TEXT); CREATE TABLE Dogs (dog_id NUMBER, owner_id NUMBER, abandoned_yn TEXT, breed_code TEXT, name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Treatments (dog_id NUMBER);

dog_kennels.question: Can you provide me with a list of all dog Ids for all of the abandoned dogs, as well as their associated treatment type code?
dog_kennels.query: SELECT t1.dog_id, t2.treatment_type_code FROM dogs AS t1 JOIN treatments AS t2 ON t1.dog_id = t2.dog_id WHERE abandoned_yn = 1
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Breeds (breed_code TEXT); CREATE TABLE Treatment_Types (treatment_type_code TEXT); CREATE TABLE Dogs (dog_id NUMBER, owner_id NUMBER, abandoned_yn TEXT, breed_code TEXT, name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Treatments (dog_id NUMBER, treatment_type_code TEXT);

dog_kennels.question: whats is total cost of treatment?
dog_kennels.query: SELECT SUM ( cost_of_treatment ) FROM treatments
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Treatments (treatment_id NUMBER, cost_of_treatment NUMBER);

dog_kennels.question: could you please find who's provide lowest cost of treatment? | you want first name or last name or both? | both
dog_kennels.query: SELECT t1.first_name, t1.last_name FROM professionals AS t1 JOIN treatments AS t2 ON t1.professional_id = t2.professional_id ORDER BY t2.cost_of_treatment ASC LIMIT 1
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Owners (first_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Professionals (first_name TEXT, last_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Treatments (treatment_id NUMBER, cost_of_treatment NUMBER);

dog_kennels.question: ok, can you show lowest cost treatment's dog id?

dog_kennels.question: Which owner has paid for the most treatments on his or her dogs ? List the owner id and last name.
dog_kennels.query: SELECT t1.owner_id , t1.last_name FROM owners AS t1 JOIN dogs AS t2 ON t1.owner_id = t2.owner_id JOIN treatments AS t3 ON t2.dog_id = t3.dog_id GROUP BY t1.owner_id ORDER BY COUNT ( * ) DESC LIMIT 1
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Owners (owner_id NUMBER, first_name TEXT, last_name TEXT, email_address TEXT); CREATE TABLE Dogs (dog_id NUMBER, owner_id NUMBER, name TEXT, age TEXT, weight TEXT); CREATE TABLE Professionals (email_address TEXT); CREATE TABLE Treatments (dog_id NUMBER);

dog_kennels.question: List the first name of professionals along with the description
dog_kennels.query: SELECT DISTINCT t1.first_name , t3.treatment_type_description FROM professionals AS t1 JOIN treatments AS t2 ON t1.professional_id = t2.professional_id JOIN treatment_types AS t3 ON t2.treatment_type_code = t3.treatment_type_code
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Owners (first_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Professionals (professional_id NUMBER, first_name TEXT, last_name TEXT);

dog_kennels.question: List the first name of professionals along with the description of the treatment they have done?
dog_kennels.query: SELECT DISTINCT t1.first_name , t3.treatment_type_description FROM professionals AS t1 JOIN treatments AS t2 ON t1.professional_id = t2.professional_id JOIN treatment_types AS t3 ON t2.treatment_type_code = t3.treatment_type_code
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Treatment_Types (treatment_type_code TEXT, treatment_type_description TEXT); CREATE TABLE Owners (first_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Professionals (professional_id NUMBER, first_name TEXT, last_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Treatments (professional_id NUMBER, treatment_type_code TEXT);

dog_kennels.question: Hi there! Can you tell me how many different professional IDs are on this list?
dog_kennels.query: SELECT COUNT ( DISTINCT professional_id ) FROM professionals
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Owners (owner_id NUMBER); CREATE TABLE Professionals (professional_id NUMBER); CREATE TABLE Treatments (professional_id NUMBER);

dog_kennels.question: Great!  Could you update this list to include both the first names and treatment type codes for each of these professionals IDs? | Do you want the ids, first name for all professionals, along with the type codes of the treatment they have done? | Yes please!
dog_kennels.query: SELECT t1.professional_id, t1.first_name , t3.treatment_type_code FROM professionals AS t1 JOIN treatments AS t2 ON t1.professional_id = t2.professional_id JOIN treatment_types AS t3 ON t2.treatment_type_code = t3.treatment_type_code
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Treatment_Types (treatment_type_code TEXT); CREATE TABLE Owners (owner_id NUMBER); CREATE TABLE Professionals (professional_id NUMBER, first_name TEXT, last_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Treatments (professional_id NUMBER, treatment_type_code TEXT);

dog_kennels.question: Excellent!  Can you filter this list to show me just the entries for the 5 most recent treatments?
dog_kennels.query: SELECT t1.professional_id, t1.first_name, t3.treatment_type_code FROM professionals AS t1 JOIN treatments AS t2 ON t1.professional_id = t2.professional_id JOIN treatment_types AS t3 ON t2.treatment_type_code = t3.treatment_type_code ORDER BY t2.date_of_treatment DESC LIMIT 5
dog_kennels.schema: CREATE TABLE Treatment_Types (treatment_type_code TEXT); CREATE TABLE Owners (owner_id NUMBER); CREATE TABLE Professionals (professional_id NUMBER, first_name TEXT, last_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Treatments (professional_id NUMBER, treatment_type_code TEXT, date_of_treatment TIME);

course_teach.question: How many teachers are there?

course_teach.question: Can you tell me the names of teachers and the number of courses they teach?
course_teach.query: SELECT t2.name , COUNT ( * ) FROM course_arrange AS t1 JOIN teacher AS t2 ON t1.teacher_id = t2.teacher_id GROUP BY t2.name

course_teach.schema: CREATE TABLE course (Course_ID NUMBER, Course TEXT); CREATE TABLE teacher (Teacher_ID NUMBER, Name TEXT); CREATE TABLE course_arrange (Course_ID NUMBER, Teacher_ID NUMBER);

museum_visit.question: What is the name of the visitor who visited both a museum opened before 2009 and a museum opened after 2011?
museum_visit.query: SELECT t1.name FROM visitor AS t1 JOIN visit AS t2 ON t1.id = t2.visitor_id JOIN museum AS t3 ON t3.museum_id = t2.museum_id WHERE t3.open_year < 2009 INTERSECT SELECT t1.name FROM visitor AS t1 JOIN visit AS t2 ON t1.id = t2.visitor_id JOIN museum AS t3 ON t3.museum_id = t2.museum_id WHERE t3.open_year > 2011
museum_visit.schema: CREATE TABLE museum (Museum_ID NUMBER, Open_Year TEXT); CREATE TABLE visitor (ID NUMBER, Name TEXT); CREATE TABLE visit (Museum_ID NUMBER, visitor_ID TEXT);

museum_visit.question: What museum did he visit before 2009?
museum_visit.query: SELECT t3.name FROM visitor AS t1 JOIN visit AS t2 ON t1.id = t2.visitor_id JOIN museum AS t3 ON t3.museum_id = t2.museum_id WHERE t3.open_year < 2009 AND t1.name = ( SELECT t1.name FROM visitor AS t1 JOIN visit AS t2 ON t1.id = t2.visitor_id JOIN museum AS t3 ON t3.museum_id = t2.museum_id WHERE t3.open_year < 2009 INTERSECT SELECT t1.name FROM visitor AS t1 JOIN visit AS t2 ON t1.id = t2.visitor_id JOIN museum AS t3 ON t3.museum_id = t2.museum_id WHERE t3.open_year > 2011 )
museum_visit.schema: CREATE TABLE museum (Museum_ID NUMBER, Name TEXT, Open_Year TEXT); CREATE TABLE visitor (ID NUMBER, Name TEXT); CREATE TABLE visit (Museum_ID NUMBER, visitor_ID TEXT);

pets_1.question: How many students have a cat pet?
pets_1.query: SELECT COUNT ( * ) FROM student AS t1 JOIN has_pet AS t2 ON t1.stuid = t2.stuid JOIN pets AS t3 ON t3.petid = t2.petid WHERE t3.pettype = 'cat'
pets_1.schema: CREATE TABLE Student (StuID NUMBER); CREATE TABLE Has_Pet (StuID NUMBER, PetID NUMBER); CREATE TABLE Pets (PetID NUMBER, PetType TEXT);

pets_1.question: And what about students that don't have a cat pet?
pets_1.query: SELECT COUNT ( * ) FROM ( SELECT stuid FROM student EXCEPT SELECT t1.stuid FROM student AS t1 JOIN has_pet AS t2 ON t1.stuid = t2.stuid JOIN pets AS t3 ON t3.petid = t2.petid WHERE t3.pettype = 'cat' )
pets_1.schema: CREATE TABLE Student (StuID NUMBER); CREATE TABLE Has_Pet (StuID NUMBER, PetID NUMBER); CREATE TABLE Pets (PetID NUMBER, PetType TEXT);

pets_1.question: And what are their ids?
pets_1.query: SELECT stuid FROM student EXCEPT SELECT t1.stuid FROM student AS t1 JOIN has_pet AS t2 ON t1.stuid = t2.stuid JOIN pets AS t3 ON t3.petid = t2.petid WHERE t3.pettype = 'cat'
pets_1.schema: CREATE TABLE Student (StuID NUMBER); CREATE TABLE Has_Pet (StuID NUMBER, PetID NUMBER); CREATE TABLE Pets (PetID NUMBER, PetType TEXT);

pets_1.schema: CREATE TABLE Student (StuID NUMBER); CREATE TABLE Has_Pet (StuID NUMBER, PetID NUMBER); CREATE TABLE Pets (PetID NUMBER, PetType TEXT);

pets_1.question: Which of those two students have a cat as their pet in addition also having a dog?
pets_1.query: SELECT t1.stuid FROM student AS t1 JOIN has_pet AS t2 ON t1.stuid = t2.stuid JOIN pets AS t3 ON t3.petid = t2.petid WHERE t3.pettype = 'dog' INTERSECT SELECT t1.stuid FROM student AS t1 JOIN has_pet AS t2 ON t1.stuid = t2.stuid JOIN pets AS t3 ON t3.petid = t2.petid WHERE t3.pettype = 'cat'
pets_1.schema: CREATE TABLE Student (StuID NUMBER); CREATE TABLE Has_Pet (StuID NUMBER, PetID NUMBER); CREATE TABLE Pets (PetID NUMBER, PetType TEXT);

voter_1.question: What area codes voted for both the contestant 'Kelly Clauss' and 'Tabatha Gehling'?
voter_1.query: SELECT t3.area_code FROM contestants AS t1 JOIN votes AS t2 ON t1.contestant_number = t2.contestant_number JOIN area_code_state AS t3 ON t2.state = t3.state WHERE t1.contestant_name = 'Tabatha Gehling' INTERSECT SELECT t3.area_code FROM contestants AS t1 JOIN votes AS t2 ON t1.contestant_number = t2.contestant_number JOIN area_code_state AS t3 ON t2.state = t3.state WHERE t1.contestant_name = 'Kelly Clauss'
voter_1.schema: CREATE TABLE AREA_CODE_STATE (area_code NUMBER, state TEXT); CREATE TABLE CONTESTANTS (contestant_number NUMBER, contestant_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE VOTES (state TEXT, contestant_number NUMBER);

network_1.schema: CREATE TABLE Highschooler (ID NUMBER, name TEXT, grade NUMBER);

network_1.question: Find the lowest  grade of the student?

network_1.question: Can you tell me which Student ID is not on the list of Friend IDs? | by student id, do you mean the student id in the table friend or all high schoolers' ids. | All high schoolers' ids

network_1.question: Can you tell me the name and the grade of student ID 1510?

network_1.question: What are the names of all of the high schoolers?
network_1.query: SELECT name FROM highschooler
network_1.schema: CREATE TABLE Highschooler (ID NUMBER, name TEXT);

network_1.question: What is the value of the greatest number of likes for each high schooler? | what  did  you mean  the value? | Sorry, the amount of the greatest number of likes.
network_1.query: SELECT COUNT ( * ) FROM likes GROUP BY student_id ORDER BY COUNT ( * ) DESC LIMIT 1
network_1.schema: CREATE TABLE Highschooler (ID NUMBER, name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Likes (student_id NUMBER, liked_id NUMBER);

network_1.question: What is the name of the high schooler who has the greatest number of likes?
network_1.query: SELECT t2.name FROM likes AS t1 JOIN highschooler AS t2 ON t1.student_id = t2.id GROUP BY t1.student_id ORDER BY COUNT ( * ) DESC LIMIT 1
network_1.schema: CREATE TABLE Highschooler (ID NUMBER, name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Likes (student_id NUMBER, liked_id NUMBER);

network_1.question: Show the names of students who have at least 2 likes.
network_1.query: SELECT t2.name FROM likes AS t1 JOIN highschooler AS t2 ON t1.student_id = t2.id GROUP BY t1.student_id HAVING COUNT ( * ) > = 2
network_1.schema: CREATE TABLE Highschooler (ID NUMBER, name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Likes (student_id NUMBER, liked_id NUMBER);

network_1.question: How about 1 like?
network_1.query: SELECT t2.name FROM likes AS t1 JOIN highschooler AS t2 ON t1.student_id = t2.id GROUP BY t1.student_id HAVING COUNT ( * ) > = 1
network_1.schema: CREATE TABLE Highschooler (ID NUMBER, name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Likes (student_id NUMBER, liked_id NUMBER);

network_1.question: What are their IDs?
network_1.query: SELECT t2.id FROM likes AS t1 JOIN highschooler AS t2 ON t1.student_id = t2.id GROUP BY t1.student_id HAVING COUNT ( * ) > = 1
network_1.schema: CREATE TABLE Highschooler (ID NUMBER, name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Likes (student_id NUMBER, liked_id NUMBER);

real_estate_properties.question: What are the names of the properties with more that one room?
real_estate_properties.query: SELECT property_name FROM properties WHERE room_count > 1
real_estate_properties.schema: CREATE TABLE Properties (property_name TEXT, room_count NUMBER);

real_estate_properties.question: What are the names of the properties that are either houses or apartments with more than one room?
real_estate_properties.query: SELECT property_name FROM properties WHERE property_type_code = "House" UNION SELECT property_name FROM properties WHERE property_type_code = "Apartment" AND room_count > 1
real_estate_properties.schema: CREATE TABLE Properties (property_name TEXT, room_count NUMBER);

real_estate_properties.question: How many rooms do each of those have?
real_estate_properties.query: SELECT property_name, room_count FROM properties WHERE property_type_code = "House" UNION SELECT property_name, room_count FROM properties WHERE property_type_code = "Apartment" AND room_count > 1
real_estate_properties.schema: CREATE TABLE Properties (property_type_code TEXT, property_name TEXT, room_count NUMBER);

real_estate_properties.question: What is the average agreed selling price of all houses with more than one room?
real_estate_properties.query: SELECT AVG ( agreed_selling_price ) FROM properties WHERE property_type_code = "House" AND room_count > 1
real_estate_properties.schema: CREATE TABLE Properties (property_id NUMBER, property_type_code TEXT, property_name TEXT, room_count NUMBER, buyer_offered_price NUMBER, agreed_selling_price NUMBER);

real_estate_properties.question: What is the feature type name of the feature AirCon?
real_estate_properties.query: SELECT t2.feature_type_name FROM other_available_features AS t1 JOIN ref_feature_types AS t2 ON t1.feature_type_code = t2.feature_type_code WHERE t1.feature_name = "AirCon"
real_estate_properties.schema: CREATE TABLE Ref_Feature_Types (feature_type_code TEXT, feature_type_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Other_Available_Features (feature_type_code TEXT, feature_name TEXT);

real_estate_properties.question: What is the full feature description of the feature name AirCon?
real_estate_properties.query: SELECT feature_description FROM other_available_features WHERE feature_name = "AirCon"
real_estate_properties.schema: CREATE TABLE Ref_Feature_Types (feature_type_code TEXT, feature_type_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Other_Available_Features (feature_type_code TEXT, feature_name TEXT, feature_description TEXT);

real_estate_properties.question: How many different feature IDs are there?
real_estate_properties.query: SELECT COUNT ( * ) FROM ( SELECT DISTINCT feature_id FROM other_available_features )
real_estate_properties.schema: CREATE TABLE Ref_Feature_Types (feature_type_code TEXT, feature_type_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Other_Available_Features (feature_id NUMBER, feature_type_code TEXT, feature_name TEXT, feature_description TEXT);

real_estate_properties.question: What sort of feature type code is associated with AirCon?
real_estate_properties.query: SELECT feature_type_code FROM other_available_features WHERE feature_name = "AirCon"
real_estate_properties.schema: CREATE TABLE Ref_Feature_Types (feature_type_code TEXT, feature_type_name TEXT); CREATE TABLE Other_Available_Features (feature_id NUMBER, feature_type_code TEXT, feature_name TEXT, feature_description TEXT);
